entries.name: greetings_before_quest
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, hello there, young one. Beautiful day, isn't it?

options.text: It is. What are you looking at, sir?
Hello. Are you alright? You seem lost in thought

entries.name: im_am_looking_at
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Ah, this old tree here. It's been standing longer than I have, you know. *chuckles softly* My Rosemary and I, we used to go here and look at the fish swim under the tree every Sunday. Those were the days...

entries.name: lost_in_thoughs
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, I'm quite alright, thank you. Just reminiscing. You see that grand oak there? It holds so many memories. My dear Rosemary and I, we'd sit here for hours, watching the world go by.

entries.name: remembering_wife
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Indeed she was. The love of my life for over fifty years. *sighs* She's gone now, but sitting here, I can almost hear her laugh through the breeze.

entries.name: fetch_some_water
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: That we did, that we did. You know, all this talking has made me quite parched. I don't suppose you could fetch an old man some <blue>water</blue>, could you? I'd go myself, but these legs aren't what they used to be.

entries.name: fetch_some_water
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Could fetch an old man some <blue>water</blue>?

options.text: Of course, I'd be happy to help

entries.name: accepted_quest
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, bless you, young one. There's a kiosk just down the path. %typewriter_3vqwGstGrMpDUAo% runs it - she's a bit brisk, but she'll sort you out. And don't worry if you can't manage it, I'll be right here enjoying the view.

entries.name: denied_quest
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: No worries, young one. I understand. Perhaps another time. You run along now, and enjoy this beautiful day.

entries.name: welcome_during_elias
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Welcome to <gradient:#629eff7:#06abf4>Swiftwater's</gradient>. What can I get you?

entries.name: your_wife
entries.text: Rosemary? Was she your wife?
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt

entries.name: sorry_for_your_loss
entries.text: I'm sorry for your loss. It sounds like you had wonderful times together.
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt

entries.name: looking_for_water
entries.text: Hello, I'm looking for some <blue>water</blue>.
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt

entries.name: for_elias_hun
entries.text: Water, huh? Let me guess, old %typewriter_AcOFr8lbHZETBry% sent you? *doesn't wait for an answer* Right, that'll be 20 Emeralds.
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo

entries.name: buy_water_options
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Right, that'll be <green>20 Emeralds<green>.

options.text: <green>20 Emeralds</green>? That seems a bit steep for <blue>water</blue>.
Oh, I'm afraid I don't have enough <green>Emeralds</green>.

entries.name: bit_to_much
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Look, it's not just any <blue>water</blue>. This is <gradient:#ad40de:#5d71e3:#8bbff5:#65dada>Premium Spring Water</gradient> from the <gray>Misty Mountains</gray>. They have to fly it all the way here which is a <yellow>4 month journey</yellow>. Plus, do you see any other shops around here? Supply and demand, kid.

entries.name: ill_buy
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Great! Here's your <gradient:#ad40de:#5d71e3:#8bbff5:#65dada>Premium Spring Water</gradient>. Make sure %typewriter_AcOFr8lbHZETBry% drinks it slowly, will you? Last thing we need is him getting the hiccups again.

entries.name: cant_buy
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Of course you don't. Listen, I'm not running a <gradient:#6d68ed:#4d71f0>charity</gradient> here. Come back when you've got the <green>Emeralds</green>. And a word of advice? Don't promise things you can't deliver.

entries.name: found_some_emeralds
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Well, well, look who's back. Found some <green>Emeralds</green> in your couch cushions, did you?

entries.name: got_the_emeralds
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Excellent. Here's your Premium Spring Water. Tell Elias it's our finest quality. And remind him we have a loyalty program - buy five, get the sixth half off. *smirks* Never hurts to plan ahead.

entries.name: doesnt_have_emeralds
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Still coming up short, huh? Look, I admire your persistence, but this isn't a 'buy now, pay later' establishment. Come back when your pockets are a little heavier, alright?

entries.name: welcome_before_elias
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Welcome to <gradient:#629eff7:#06abf4>Swiftwater's</gradient>. What'll it be?

entries.name: just_looking_around
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: Just looking around. What do you sell here?

entries.name: what_i_sell
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: We've got all sorts of supplies. Snacks, trinkets, the usual tourist trap fare. Our specialty is <gradient:#ad40de:#5d71e3:#8bbff5:#65dada>Premium Spring Water</gradient> from the <gray>Misty Mountains</gray>. Very popular, especially with the locals.

entries.name: premium_spring_water
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: <gradient:#ad40de:#5d71e3:#8bbff5:#65dada>Premium Spring Water</gradient>? What makes it special?

entries.name: mysticals_of_the_water
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Oh, it's got minerals you can't find anywhere else. Some say it has rejuvenating properties. *leans in, lowering her voice* Between you and me, I think it's just really good marketing. But hey, people love it, especially old %typewriter_AcOFr8lbHZETBry%.

entries.name: whos_elias
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: Who's %typewriter_AcOFr8lbHZETBry%?

entries.name: elias_is
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: Local character. Sweet old man, always sits by the big oak tree in the square. He's my best customer for the water. *pauses, then adds with a smirk* Mostly because he always forgets to bring his own, I think.

entries.name: thanks_for_information
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: Thanks for the information.

entries.name: thats_what_im_here_for
entries.speaker: 3vqwGstGrMpDUAo
entries.text: That's what I'm here for. Well, that and separating tourists from their Emeralds. *winks* Come back anytime!

entries.name: return_without_water
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, hello again, young one! Did you manage to fetch some <blue>water</blue>?

entries.name: have_no_water
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: I'm sorry, I couldn't get the <blue>water</blue> yet.

entries.name: sharing_apple_for_juice
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, don't you worry about that. It's the thought that counts, isn't it? *chuckles softly* You know, this reminds me of the time Rosemary and I were on a picnic and forgot to bring any drinks. We ended up sharing an apple for its juice. *sighs happily* Sometimes the best memories come from little mishaps

entries.name: ill_try_to_get_water
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: That's a nice way to look at it. I'll try to get the <blue>water</blue> for you soon.

entries.name: youre_very_kind
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: You're very kind. But please, don't trouble yourself too much. I'm quite content here with my memories and this beautiful view. *gestures to the tree* Though, if you do happen to pass by %typewriter_3vqwGstGrMpDUAo%'s kiosk again, a sip of water would be lovely.

entries.name: returns_with_water
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Well, hello there! Oh, is that... did you bring some <blue>water</blue>?

entries.name: heres_water
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: Yes, here you go.

entries.name: bless_you
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Oh, bless you, child. You're as kind as you are thoughtful. You know, Rosemary always said that the simplest gestures often mean the most.

entries.name: glad_could_help
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: I'm glad I could help. How are you feeling now?

entries.name: reminiscing
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Much better, thank you. You know, sitting here, enjoying this water, it reminds me of the picnics Rosemary and I used to have. We'd sit under this very tree, sharing a drink, watching the world go by. In a way, it feels like she's still here with me.

entries.name: sounds_wonderful
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: It sounds like you have wonderful memories together.

entries.name: small_reward
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Indeed I do. And now, thanks to your kindness, I have a new pleasant memory to add to them. *reaches into his pocket* Here, I want you to have this. It's not much, but it's a little token of my appreciation.

entries.name: loves_company
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: Feel free to come by and chat anytime. An old man like me always enjoys good company, especially from thoughtful young folks like yourself.

entries.name: nice_meeting
entries.speaker: IOJScZCrj9hHirt
entries.text: Thank you, %typewriter_AcOFr8lbHZETBry%. It was nice meeting you.

entries.name: take_care_now
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
entries.text: The pleasure was all mine. Take care now, and remember to appreciate the little things in life. They often turn out to be the big things in the end.

entries.name: returns_after_quest
entries.speaker: AcOFr8lbHZETBry
messages: Hello there! You caught me lost in thought. I was pondering how this tree <#4CAF50>starts anew each spring, despite its age. Perhaps there's hope for us old timers yet, eh? *winks*

Well, if it isn't my young friend! You know, sitting here, I sometimes feel like I'm looking at a <#FF9800>living history book</#FF9800>. This tree's seen more than all of us combined. Makes you wonder what <gradient:#EECDA3:#EF629F>secrets it holds</gradient>.

Oh, hello! I was just thinking about how this old tree has been a <#6079fa>constant in my life</#6079fa>. Seasons come and go, but it remains. There's <gradient:#43C6AC:#30c2d5>comfort in that</gradient>, don't you think? Ah, listen to me wax philosophical!

Hello there! You know, I've been watching the <#8BC34A>birds in this tree all morning. Reminds me of how Rosemary loved birdwatching. She could name every species just by their song. Remarkable woman, she was.

Ah, good to see you! I was just thinking, this tree must have <#ff5f84>countless stories</#ff5f84> to tell if it could talk. Then again, maybe its <gradient:#3d91cb:#6DD5FA>silence is a story</gradient> in itself. What do you think? Oh, never mind an old man's ramblings.
Hello, young one! I was just reminiscing about the time Rosemary and I had a picnic here during a meteor shower. We counted stars until dawn. Funny how some memories stay so vivid, isn't it?

Well, look who's here! You know, I've been sitting here thinking about how <#c352d7>times change</#c352d7>. This tree's seen it all, hasn't it? Yet here it stands, <gradient:#FF512F:#f13d86>strong as ever</gradient>. There's a lesson in that, I think.

Oh, it's you! Say, have you ever noticed how the bark on this old oak forms <#FF4500>patterns? Sometimes I swear I can see faces in there. Rosemary used to say I had an overactive imagination. *chuckles* Maybe she was right.
Ah, hello there! I was just thinking about the time Rosemary and I danced under this very tree during the Harvest Festival. The leaves seemed to dance with us, you know. Magical evening, that was.
You know, the kindness you showed me with that water - it gives me <#4CAF50>hope for the future</#4CAF50>. It's nice to know there are still <green>good-hearted</green> people in this world.
I found an <#1fa0ed>old photo of Rosemary and me sitting right here on this bench. We haven't changed a bit! Well, maybe I'm a tad grayer. *chuckles*
Did you know this tree is <#FFD700>older than our village</#FFD700>? It's seen so much history. Sometimes I wonder what <gradient:#3494E6:#d38efe>stories it could tell</gradient> if it could speak.

I was remembering our village's summer festival from years ago. The entire square was decorated, and this old tree was draped in <#ee85df>ribbons. Oh, how Rosemary loved to dance under those colorful streamers.

Have you ever noticed how the breeze sounds <#4DB6AC>different through leaves</#4DB6AC> than through pine needles? It's like <gradient:#FFAFBD:#FFC3A0>nature's own symphony</gradient>, playing just for us.
I had the strangest dream last night. Rosemary and I were dancing under this tree, but its leaves were made of <#50C878>Emeralds! Imagine that - an <#50C878>Emerald tree. Quite the sight it was!

You know, young one, every day I sit here, I notice something <gradient:#f89702:#FF6B6B>new about this old tree</gradient>. Life's funny that way - always something fresh to discover if you look closely enough.
